maps.convert.osm2gml

Class ConvertTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • maps.convert.osm2gml.ConvertTools

  • public final class ConvertTools
extends java.lang.Object
    Useful tools for converting OSM to GML.

        Returns:

      • nearbyThreshold

                     double thresholdM)
        Compute the nearby-node threshold for an OSMMap in degrees.
        Parameters:
        map - The map to look up.
        thresholdM - The desired threshold in meters.
        Returns:
        The size of the nearby-node threshold for the map in degrees.

      • findLeftTurn

        public static Edge findLeftTurn(DirectedEdge from,
                java.util.Set<? extends Edge> candidates)
        Find the "leftmost" turn in a particular direction, i.e. the one with the highest left angle, or the lowest right angle if there are no left turns possible.
        Parameters:
        from - The edge we're turning from.
        candidates - The set of edges we could turn into.
        Returns:
        The leftmost turn.

      • findRightTurn

        public static Edge findRightTurn(DirectedEdge from,
                 java.util.Set<? extends Edge> candidates)
        Find the "rightmost" turn in a particular direction, i.e. the one with the highest right angle, or the lowest left angle if there are no right turns possible.
        Parameters:
        from - The edge we're turning from.
        candidates - The set of edges we could turn into.
        Returns:
        The rightmost turn.

      • findBestTurn

        public static Edge findBestTurn(DirectedEdge from,
                java.util.Set<? extends Edge> candidates,
                boolean preferLeft)
        Find the "best" turn in a particular direction. If left turns are preferred then the "best" turn is the one with the highest left angle, or the lowest right angle. For right turns, the "best" is the one with the highest right angle or the lowest left angle.
        Parameters:
        from - The edge we're turning from.
        candidates - The set of edges we could turn into.
        preferLeft - Whether to prefer left turns or not.
        Returns:
        The best turn.

                  double expected,
                  double threshold)
        Is a number approximately equal to another number?
        Parameters:
        n - The number to test.
        expected - The expected value.
        threshold - The threshold.
        Returns:
        If n is within [expected - threshold, expected + threshold].

        map - The OSMMap the building is part of.

      • isClockwise

        public static boolean isClockwise(OSMBuilding building,
                  OSMMap map)
        Find out if an OSMBuilding is defined clockwise or not.
        Parameters:
        building - The OSMBuilding to check.
        map - The OSM map.
        Returns:
        True if the building is defined clockwise, false if anti-clockwise.
